name: Connect to Edge Cassandra Cluster.txt - SSL Certificate for Cassandra
description: This section provides instructions for creating an SSL certificate file for connecting to a Cassandra cluster. It explains that you need to connect to a specific server (datastore jump box) and create a certificate file named 'kong_CLIENT.cer.pem' in your home directory. The path to this certificate file needs to be exported using a command. This certificate is likely required for secure communication with the Cassandra cluster.
use_cases: Establishing secure communication with a Cassandra cluster
Setting up SSL/TLS encryption for Cassandra

name: Connect to Edge Cassandra Cluster.txt - Steps to Connect to Cassandra
description: This section provides instructions on how to connect to a Cassandra cluster securely using SSL encryption. It involves exporting the SSL certificate file path as an environment variable, and then using the 'cqlsh' command with the appropriate parameters to establish a secure connection to the Cassandra cluster. This allows users to interact with the Cassandra database in a secure manner, ensuring data privacy and integrity.
use_cases: Connecting to a Cassandra cluster securely using SSL encryption
Interacting with a Cassandra database in a secure manner
Ensuring data privacy and integrity when accessing Cassandra
